top_categories.workout_context: Whiskey Off-Road's Singletrack, Doubletrack forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 50 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Whiskey Off-Road's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
6,523ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
50 miles on classic Southwest MTB with singletrack, fire burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
130ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Whiskey Off-Road, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Whiskey Off-Road, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Base fitness for Whiskey Off-Road. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Whiskey Off-Road. Train it until it feels boring.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on classic Southwest MTB with singletrack, fire. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
6,523ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Smooth pedaling at 50 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.

race_overlay.heat: April in Prescott, Arizona can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Whiskey Off-Road. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Whiskey Off-Road’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Whiskey Off-Road. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Whiskey Off-Road demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride classic southwest mtb with singletrack, fire roads, and technical descents at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: singletrack, doubletrack, gravel roads. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 50 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 50 miles of classic southwest mtb with singletrack, fire roads, and technical descents in Prescott, Arizona.
